title: 114_hr1162
content: The "Science Prize Competitions Act" may be cited as the short title. Amendments to prize competitions are included in the Act. Amendments to the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 include changes to prize competitions, such as inserting "competition" after "prize" and replacing "prizes" with "prize competitions." Additionally, the amendments specify that information about competitions should be publicly accessible on websites like www.challenge.gov and refer to cash prize purses instead of just prizes. The amendments to the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 include changes to prize competitions, allowing agencies to waive certain requirements. Annual reports must include a list of waivers granted and reasons for granting them. The amendments to the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 allow agencies to conduct prize competitions with federal and private sector funds. Agencies can enter into agreements with private entities to administer the competitions. The Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 allows agencies to conduct prize competitions with federal and private sector funds. The head of an agency may accept funds from other Federal agencies, private sector entities, and nonprofit entities for prize competitions. Special consideration cannot be given in return for donations. Amendments include changing "prize awards" to "cash prize purses" and clarifying language regarding prize competitions and cash prize purses. Amendments to the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 include changing "prize awards" to "cash prize purses" in various paragraphs and clarifying language regarding prize competitions and cash prize purses. Additional changes involve allowing for-profit and nonprofit entities to participate in prize competitions and specifying the use of cash prize purses in certain subsections.
